decision_conditions: <p>The proposed development, by reason of its internal configuration, proposed use as multiple living spaces and separate access via a rear shared access road, has not been demonstrated to be an ancillary use to the main dwellinghouse.&nbsp;A separate habitable unit within a residential garden would be out of character with the surrounding development pattern and would result in the generation of excess noise and disturbance, unduly impacting&nbsp;neighbouring amenity.<br></p><p><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"=""><span arial="">The proposal therefore fails to comply with:</span><br></span></p><p><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">- National Planning Policy Framework&nbsp;</span>National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="" style="line-height: 14.98px;">- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021)<o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">- Policy CP3 of the&nbsp;</span>Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)<o:p></o:p></p><p><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the&nbsp;</span>Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="" style="line-height: 14.98px;">- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"></p><p><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">- Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of&nbsp;</span>The London Borough of Barking and Dagenhamâ€™s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</p>
